hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: In this exercise we’ll be practising experiencing challenging or difficult emotions. Just as they are. As a way to spend less energy trying to avoid the uncomfortable, and more on what matters to us in the long run.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.heading: What would it mean to practice moving through difficulties, in your life?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text:
Well done. 

We’ve just practised moving through difficulties instead of trying to avoid them. This technique can help us live more in line with our values and lead more meaningful lives.

en.name: PsyPal Being with what is

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

en.description: Running into obstacles is a natural part of life. With the things we want in life – like for example love, growth, interesting work – the risk of being hurt is always present. Even though we seldom acknowledge it, and often try to avoid it. In this week’s exercise we’ll practice the opposite: moving through difficulties.

content.text: I denne øvelse vil vi træne dét at opleve udfordrende eller svære følelser. Præcis som de er. Som en måde, hvor vi kan bruge mindre energi på at forsøge at undgå det ubehagelige – og mere energi på det, der betyder noget for os i det lange løb.

hostNotes.text:
Find a comfortable position. I will start the audio exercise and we'll meet back here afterwards. 

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

xxMain question

xxFurther explanations of main question if needed

You can take notes on a piece of paper or just mental notes in your head. And there is no right or wrong here, our answers are our own. 1 minute starting now.

> Press play to start the timer.

That’s 1 minute and it’s time to move on.

content.text: Hvordan ville det se ud i dit liv, hvis du skulle øve dig i at bevæge dig gennem det, som er svært?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

content.text: Hvordan ville det se ud i dit liv, hvis du skulle øve dig i at bevæge dig gennem det, som er svært?

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text: Vi har lige øvet os i at bevæge os gennem det, der er svært, i stedet for at prøve at undgå det. Denne teknik kan hjælpe os med at leve mere meningsfuldt og i overensstemmelse med vores værdier.

da.name: At være med det som er

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

da.description:
At støde på forhindringer er en naturlig del af livet. Med de ting, vi ønsker i livet – som for eksempel kærlighed, udvikling, interessant arbejde – er risikoen for at blive såret altid til stede. Selvom vi sjældent anerkender det og ofte prøver at undgå det.
I denne uges øvelse vil vi øve det modsatte: at bevæge os gennem vanskeligheder.

hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: V tomto cvičení budeme trénovat prožívání náročných nebo obtížných emocí takových, jaké jsou. Je to způsob, jak vynaložit méně energie na snahu vyhnout se nepříjemnému a věnovat ji více tomu, na čem nám dlouhodobě záleží.

content.heading: Co by pro váš život znamenalo učit se takto zvládat obtíže?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

content.heading: Co by pro váš život znamenalo učit se takto zvládat obtíže?

Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text: Právě jsme se učili zvládat potíže pomocí přijetí namísto snahy se jim vyhýbat. Tato technika nám může pomoci žít více v souladu s našimi hodnotami a vést smysluplnější život.

cs.name: Žijte s tím, co je

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

cs.description:
Potkávat překážky je přirozenou součástí života. U věcí, které v životě chceme – jako například láska, růst, zajímavá práce – je riziko obtíží vždy přítomné. I když to málokdy uznáváme a často se tomu snažíme vyhnout.

Ve cvičení pro tento týden vám nabídneme opačný přístup ke zvládání obtíží.

hostNotes.text:
Welcome. I am X and today we will work for around 30 minutes on xx

We’ll be doing xx ex. meditation followed by time for reflection and sharing with each other.

Let’s start with a mini check-in. How are you feeling right now? Please answer in two-three words. X, would you like to start?

> Let everyone in the session, including yourself, check in one by one.

Thank you all for checking in. Let’s get started.

content.text: In deze oefening gaan we oefenen met het ervaren van lastige of moeilijke emoties. Precies zoals ze zijn. Om zo minder energie te besteden aan het proberen te vermijden van het ongemakkelijke, en meer aan wat belangrijk voor ons is op de lange termijn.

hostNotes.text:

> Push play to start the audio exercise

Now we’ll take 1 minute to reflect on our own.

content.text: Wat zou het betekenen om te oefenen met door moeilijkheden heen gaan, in jouw leven?

hostNotes.text:
Now we are getting into the sharing part. We have three rules for sharing:

1. **What is said in here, stays in here.**
2. **All you need to do is listen.** There is no fixing, helping or advice-giving needed. We are just showing up and exploring what ourselves and others are going through.

3. **Everything on the inside is okay.** Anger, love, hatred, sadness. Whatever shows up. No wrongs, no rights. It is what it is.

There will be a timer set for 2 minutes as an indicator. If you don’t want to share you can always say ‘pass’.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone (or as many as you got time for) share one by one. Press play to start the timer. Re-start for each new sharing.

Thank you so much everyone.

hostNotes.text:
Well done. If you’re up for it, you can continue what we started here today with a mission to bring this into your everyday life.

xx mission description

Before we leave this space let’s do a mini check-out. 

How are you feeling right now? Has anything shifted? Please answer in two-three words.

Who would like to start?

> Let everyone in the session check out one by one.

Thank you all for checking out and for joining this session today.

> Finish session to send everyone off to the exit experience.

content.text: We hebben net geoefend met door moeilijkheden heen gaan in plaats van ze te vermijden. Deze techniek kan ons helpen om meer te leven volgens wat we belangrijk vinden en een betekenisvoller leven te leiden.

nl.name: Zijn met wat is

hostNotes.text: > Start the session when you're ready to go

nl.description:
Het tegenkomen van obstakels is een normaal onderdeel van het leven. Bij de dingen die we graag willen – zoals bijvoorbeeld liefde, groei, interessant werk – is er altijd een kans om gekwetst te worden. Ook al zien we dat niet vaak zo, en proberen we het vaak te vermijden.

In de oefening van deze week gaan we het tegenovergestelde oefenen: door moeilijkheden heen gaan.
